DOC.HEAD: Allowed to Travel to Colorado and Florida
DOC.TEXT: Saudi financier Adnan Khashoggi, awaiting trial on charges he helped Ferdinand and Imelda Marcos in the alleged plunder of the Philippine government, was granted permission Wednesday to take a vacation to Colorado and Florida. Khashoggi has been free on $10 million bail since he was extradited to this country from Switzerland in July. Conditions on his bail include that he remain in New York and that his movements be monitored by an electronic bracelet. Khashoggi, who has pleaded innocent to the charges, has been living in a luxurious Fifth Avenue penthouse. His trial with Mrs. Marcos is scheduled to begin March 14. U.S. District Judge John Keenan granted his request for the three-week vacation to visit family after Khashoggi's lawyer, Robert Morvillo, said in a letter that federal prosecutors had consented to it. According to his itinerary, Khashoggi will spend Dec. 27 to Jan. 3 at the home of his son, Mohammed, in Aspen, Colo. He then will travel to Fort Lauderdale, Fla., where he will stay at the Mariott Harbour Beach Resort. Morvillo said his letter that Khashoggi would visit with his sister, who lives in Florida.
